title: David Bowie’s ‘Hunky Dory’ at 50
sub_head: The hit-filled album marked a major turning point in the star’s career and remains as fresh today as it was at its release a half-century ago.
body: In early 1971, David Bowie was adrift. His first three albums had been commercial flops and he was fed up with the studio recording process, especially repetitive takes that he referred to as a “nightmare.” Still unable to land a long-term deal with a record label, he was determined to wrest control of his next effort—if there was one.
